info.title: urlscan.io APIs
info.description:
### Introduction

API endpoints for urlscan.io and urlscan Pro. Most of these API endpoints
require authentication.

The fastest way to start working with our APIs is by using one of the many
existing commercial or open-source integrations.

### External Resources
* [urlscan.io website](https://urlscan.io)
* [urlscan.io Documentation Hub](https://docs.urlscan.io)
* [urlscan.io API Status](https://status.urlscan.io)

search.name: Testsearch
search.longDescription: This Saved Search was created for testing purposes by Postman

_id.description: Unique ID of the Saved Search

datasource.description: Which data this Saved Search operates on

createdAt.description: Time when the Saved Search was created.

permissions.description: Determine whether other users on the team or on urlscan Pro can see the search.

tlp.description: TLP (Traffic Light Protocol) indicator for other users on the urlscan Pro platform

usertags.description: User-supplied tags to be applied to matching items. Need to be prefixed with `pro.`, `public.`, `private.`, or `team.` to control visibility.

pageState.description:
If the pageState field is set then there are
additional results available. Repeat the API call with the
pageState value to get the next batch of results.

data_type.description: Indicates if there is additional data in the `data` field.

data.description: Additional JSON content for this record.

state.description: Whether the incident is active or closed

createdAt.description: Time when the incident was created.

expireAt.description: Time when the incident will automatically be closed.

watchedAttributes.description: Determine which items will be monitored for.

countries.description: List of countries to scan from as ISO-3166-1 country codes.

countriesPerInterval.description: How many countries to use per scan interval.

userAgents.description: List of HTTP user-agent classes to use for scanning.

userAgentsPerInterval.description: How many user agents to use per scan interval.

stopDelaySuspended.description: When to automatically close the incident after the observable was suspended.

stopDelayInactive.description: When to automatically close the incident after the observable became inactive.

stopDelayMalicious.description: When to automatically close the incident after the observable became malicious.

scanIntervalAfterSuspended.description: How to change the scan interval after the observable was suspended.

scanIntervalAfterMalicious.description: How to change the scan interval after the observable became malicious.

sourceId.description: ID of the original item that created this incident.

incidentProfile.description: ID of the incident profile to use when creating this incident.

stateSize.description: Size in bytes of incident states in database.

stateCount.description: Number of stored incident states in database.

scanIntervalMode.description: If this is set to manual then scanIntervalAfterSuspended and scanIntervalAfterMalicious will not have an effect.

total.description: Total number of results with an exact count up to 10,000 results.

has_more.description: True if there are more than 10,000 results.

pageTimeout.description: Time to wait for the whole scan process (in ms)

captureDelay.description: Delay after page has finished loading before capturing page content

extraHeaders.description: Extra Key-Value headers to send via the HTTP headers

limit.description: Maximum allowed usage for this period

used.description: Amount of quota used in this period

tags.name: Generic
tags.description: API endpoints related to the platform or the user account.

tags.name: Scanning
tags.description: These APIs allow URLs to be scanned and the results of the scans to be retrieved.

tags.name: Search
tags.description: The Search API allows users to search for historically website scans, hostnames, domains, TLS certificates and incidents.

tags.name: Live Scanning
tags.description:
**urlscan Pro** - Live Scanning allows users to scan websites from different geographical locations and using different device settings.

See additional info about this proprietary feature on [urlscan Pro](https://pro.urlscan.io/help/livescan).

tags.name: Saved Searches
tags.description: **urlscan Pro** - Saved Searches are rules that are executed inline against new incoming scans and hostnames.

tags.name: Subscriptions
tags.description: **urlscan Pro** - Subscriptions allow notifications for Saved Searches.

tags.name: Hostnames
tags.description: **urlscan Pro** - Historical information on hostnames and domains

tags.name: Incidents
tags.description: **urlscan Pro** - Incidents track observables, like hostnames and domains, and automatically scan and alert on changes.

post.description: Submit a URL to be scanned and control options for how the scan should be performed.

visibility.description: Intended visibility of the final scan result

country.description: Country to scan from. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format. If not supplied, an appropriate country will automatically be chosen.

tags.description: User-defined tags to annotate this scan, e.g. "phishing" or "malicious".

overrideSafety.description: If set to any value, this will disable reclassification of URLs with potential PII in them. Use with care!

referer.description: Override HTTP referer for this scan

customagent.description: Override HTTP User-Agent for this scan

uuid.description: UUID for scan result, also called $scanId

get.description:
The Search API is used to find historical scans performed on the
platform. Some data sources and searchable fields are only available on **urlscan Pro**.

The API search will only indicate an exact count of results up to 10,000 results in the total property. After that the `has_more` flag will be true. Use the `sort` value of the last (i.e. oldest) scan result in the current list of results as a parameter for the next Search API call. Supply this value in the `search_after` query parameter for getting the next (older) batch of results.

API search will find Public scans performed by anyone as well as Unlisted and Private scans performed by you or your teams.
For query syntax and searchable fields, refer to
[https://urlscan.io/docs/search/](https://urlscan.io/docs/search/)

parameters.name: search_after
parameters.description: For retrieving the next batch of results, send the value of the `sort` attribute of the last (oldest) result you received (comma-separated) from the previous call.

parameters.name: datasource
parameters.description:
Datasources to search: scans (urlscan.io), hostnames, incidents, notifications,
certificates (urlscan Pro)

get.description: Using the Scan ID received from the Submission API, you can use the Result API to poll for the scan. The most efficient approach would be to wait at least 10 seconds before starting to poll, and then only polling 2-second intervals with an eventual upper timeout in case the scan does not return.

data.description: Raw scan data including network requests, responses, cookies, console logs, and page elements

stats.description: Statistical analysis of the scan including resource counts, protocols, security metrics, and geographic distribution

meta.description: Enriched metadata from external processors including domain rankings, geolocation, DNS records, and ASN information

task.description: Information about the scan task including configuration, URLs, and submission details

page.description: Information about the scanned page including server details, location, and network properties

lists.description: Aggregated lists of unique elements found during the scan including IPs, domains, URLs, and certificates

verdicts.description: Security verdicts and threat analysis from multiple sources including urlscan.io, third-party engines, and community ratings

submitter.description: Information about the entity that submitted the scan request

get.description: Use the scan UUID to retrieve the screenshot for a scan once the scan has finished.
Use the scan UUID to retrieve the DOM snapshot for a scan once the scan has finished.
Retrieve countries available for scanning using the Scan API
Get grouped user agents to use with the Scan API.

get.description: API Endpoint to get available and used API quotas.
API Endpoint to get a list of brands that are tracked as part of urlscan's brand and phishing detection.

_id.description: Unique database ID of the brand

country.description: Countries of operation for this brand

get.description: Get the list of brands that we are able to detect phishing pages, the total number of detected pages and the latest hit for each brand. This is _slower_ than the availableBrands endpoint.
**urlscan Pro** - The Phishing URL endpoint is a convenience method over the Search API for retrieving detected pages. Unless you have a specific reason not to, you should use the Search API instead!

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Can be one of csv, tsv, or json

get.description: API Endpoint to a list of available Live Scanning nodes along with their current metadata.

post.description: Task a URL to be scanned. The HTTP request will return with the scan UUID immediately and then it is your responsibility to poll the result resource type until the scan has finished.
Task a URL to be scanned. The HTTP request will **block** until the scan has finished.

get.description: Get the historical observations for a specific hostname in the "Hostnames" data source.

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description:
* For result, screenshot, dom: UUID of the scan
* For response, download: The SHA256 of the resource

put.description: Store the temporary scan as a permanent snapshot on urlscan.io.

delete.description: Purge temporary scan from scanner immediately. Scans will be automatically purged after 60 minutes.

get.description: Get the historical observations for a specific hostname in the "Hostnames" data source.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Return at most this many results. Minimum 10 Maximum 10000 Default 1000

parameters.name: pageState
parameters.description: Returns additional results starting from this page state from the previous API call.

get.description: Get information about the current user or API key making the request.

**urlscan Pro** - Get structurally similar results to a specific scan. See
description for this propietary feature on [urlscan
Pro](https://pro.urlscan.io/help/structuresearch).

parameters.name: search_after
parameters.description: Parameter to iterate over older results

parameters.name: scanId
parameters.description: The original scan to compare to

get.description: Get a list of Saved Searches for the current user.

uuid.description: UUID of the created saved search
UUID of the deleted saved search

get.description: Get the search results for a specific Saved Search.
Get a list of Subscriptions for the current user.

searchIds.description: Array of search IDs associated with this subscription

emailAddresses.description: Email addresses to send notifications to

put.description: Update the settings for a subscription.

get.description: Get the search results for a specific subscription and datasource.

200.description: OK - This endpoint always responds with HTTP/302

302.description: HTTP redirect to the query against the Search API to retrieve the hits.

get.description: Get a list of notification channels for the current user.

post.description: Create an incident with specific options

get.description: Get details for a specific incident.

put.description: Update specific runtime options of the incident
Restart a closed incident. Automatically extends the incident expireAt. Starts with new incident states.
Copy an incident without its history.
Copy an incident along with its history (incident states).

get.description: Get the list of attributes which can be supplied to the watchedAttributes property of the incident.
Retrieve individual incident states of an incident.

_id.description: Unique ID of incident state interval

get.description:
**urlscan Pro** - Download a file by SHA256 hash. For the ZIP files delivered by this
endpoint, the default encryption password is `urlscan!` - including the
trailing exclamation mark. The ZIP file contains a single file named
after the SHA256 of the requested file.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description:
The password to use to encrypt the ZIP file. Using a password is
mandatory, the default password is urlscan!

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description:
Specify the name of the ZIP file that should be downloaded. This
does not change the name of files within the ZIP archive. The
default filename is $fileHash.zip
